summary:
An advocate of change within business-as-usual systems to increase efficiency and achieve development targets that are sustainable. With an academic background in economics, environmental science, and sustainable development, I am interested in development that is nested in a trans-disciplinary framework of environmental, social and economic considerations. 

I work at SouthSouthNorth in the climate development space on the Future Climate for Africa (FCFA) programme as a project manager. Simultaneously, I am completing my Masters in Energy and Development at the University of Cape Town specialising in climate-resilient energy infrastructure focusing on incorporating climate change considerations into the plan and design of hydropower infrastructure.

Our clients include governments, philanthropic and impact investors, development banks, and multilateral development organisations. Current major programmes include: hosting the Future Climate for Africa (FCFA) Programme's Coordination, Capacity Building and Knowledge Exchange (CCKE), the Climate Resilient Infrastructure Development Facility (CRIDF) for the SADC region, the lead of the Climate Development Knowledge Network (CDKN), and the South African Community Based Adaptation Small Grants Facility (SGF).
